alert.note: Alert for Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 8:57PM CDT until May 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Cherokee, Muskogee and Okfuskee. In northeast Oklahoma, Creek, Okmulgee and Wagoner. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 857 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Wagoner... Okfuskee... Coweta... Fort Gibson... Haskell... Morris... Beggs... Okay... Hulbert... Porter... Schulter... Taft... Boynton... Tullahassee... Stonebluff... Bald Hill... Preston... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
